description: Oh, and the menu board is incredibly difficult to read! The spacing of the letters is awkward. Kind of important when a lot of vegetarians/vegans are frequenting.
author: Richard R.

description: I need low carb keto-friendly food right now. Just discovered my local cafe, As Quoted has a great selection of things I can eat for any time of day that keep me on plan.   Just had the SLOW Frisee salad with bacon and poached egg and lemony viniegerette and a cup of bone broth.    It hit the spot!  Thanks for making home made nutritious healthy food available on Sacramento Street!
author: Traci T.

description: Really tasty food in a chic little place and cute area!!  My mom had the BLT toast and LOVED IT. I had the almond butter toast w/ banana (both on gluten free bread!!) super yummy and filling. Definitely worth it for a lunch stop in San Fran.
author: Shayna M.

description: Ambience, convenience, awesome staff, tasty food, great décor, ideal seating arrangements for small groups and also for individuals trying to get something done, low noise level, well thought out power for laptop users, fresh pressed juices on hand, unusual coffee concoctions, tasty cookies, excellent salads. In a couple words - excellent execution. Good job! If there is any negative at all - it's that I really really really wish they took Apple Pay. Square & Verafone provide easy access to NFC payment. Just something to consider for all of us smartphone users who just want to tap out. :)
author: John-Michael S.

description: Great concept - super modern and cute restaurant but way too pricy for what you end up getting. You pay $12+ for two pieces of toast with lox and the toast is way too small to have two adequate open face sandwiches. Their kitchen is also open so customers can watch and they didn't seem to care texting and then handling the food.
author: Molly S.

description: Beautiful coffee house with healthy elegant food options.  All breads and pastries are gluten free, but also taste delicious.  You won't miss the gluten.  Decor is clean, stylish and serene.  You'll want to move in!
author: Nan B.

description: Worst service I have ever encountered. I am really baffled how they can stay open. Nothing can make up for bad customer service and very poorly trained and rude personnel. I am not sure whether the owner or manager are aware of how this place is really run. Any stakeholder on this business should look into it.
author: Youcef M.

description: I love their muff-tata and gf banana muffin, both super delicious. I also ordered the snowy plover and it doesn't compare to the ones from Andytown.The barista added way too much seltzer water and not enough coffee. With ice and whipped cream added, it caused my drink to over spilled. It was a mess. I'll stick to the snowy plover at Andytown, but I'll come back for
author: Barbara C.

description: Love the ambiance, but the "hot" chocolate was by far the worse hot chocolate I've ever tried. It tastes more like warm (whole) milk with a hint of chocolate than anything else.
author: Danna B.

description:
I really wanted to like this place. I only live a block and a half away so it's great to have a neighborhood cafe around. The premise seems like it's on point--slow food, local etc. The place has plenty of seating. It's all set up to be great but it fell short. Maybe because it's new and they're still figuring out the kinks? But really some things should be thought of immediately and remedied. I ordered the kale, avocado Caesar salad. All Caesar salads are pretty basic... They must have lettuce, Parmesan (they're using the cheaper pecorino) and croutons and the dressing. This ones a bit different because of the kale and avocado additions, which I'm totally fine with (I'm all for creativity). When the salad came out, it was a fine portion but to my discovery there were no croutons as listed. Croutons are essential to a Caesar salad. Maybe they just forgot so I asked. Nope. Apparently "we've never had them. It's listed on the menu, but we haven't had them." 1) put a note on the sign! 2) don't call it a Caesar salad 3) if you don't do the rest tell us before we pay
Ok, so here's the funny thing. The barista meant well. She asked if I'd like a cookie or a slice of bread to make up for it. I said I'd take a slice of bread. She said "normally it's extra for bread on the side".... Hmm ok cool. Good to know. Minutes later the kitchen guy comes out apologizing with literally a slice of bread that he must've put in the toaster and cut up into little square pieces. What?! These aren't croutons. Don't even try to disguise it. Now I wanted a slice of bread but instead got some soft cubes with burnt edges. 

I'd like to try the turmeric latte. When I can justify spending $4 for it maybe I'll drop by again but I'm staying away from the disgrace of a "Caesar"
author: Stella H.

description: A little pricey but everything tastes really good. Even the muffins are super fresh and godly . The place is also decorated very nicely ! Great place to work
author: Shirley L.

description: A fine postmodern place where a woman alone can enjoy a healthful meal, without waiting for fancier places to open for the evening. Just up the block from The Ribbonerie.
author: Dani L.

description: I've been here a few times since and tried them again, and I really like it now!  The people working at the front are friendly, and everything has been so good.  Whether it's breakfast or lunch.  The chairs aren't really designed for lounging and staying a while, but that's fine with me.
author: Geri C.

description: Mediocre cafe au lait, underwhelming sweet sandwich, too bad $10 down the drain except for the pleasant environment and location.
author: Patrik A.

description: Yes, gluten free, organic, fresh, delicious, high quality, high prices, some poor serving sizes... zuchinni paperdelle.... crazy
author: Emilia G.

description: The avocado toast was quality and the atmosphere was elegant. The help was ever so helpful. The turmeric latte was a bit odd in my opinion.
author: Fernilla S.

description: Banana muffin was killer ! Coffee was great ! Highly recommend. Servers were really excellent (kind and helpful with children )
author: Imran M.

description: The ambiance of this place is super cool--white everywhere, very bright, and they got dope flowers on all of the tables. The coffee is really good and the opened face sandwiches are bomb (especially anything with lox and lemon). It wasn't too crowded when we came here but I could see how it can be during peak hours. Parking also was not too bad to find.
author: Song V.

description: I love their menu: very healthy, totally tasty, best cesar salad, great coffee, and their gluten free bread and muffins are awesome. What I didn't like was that it was noisy and the seating doesn't have backs. (Really uncomfortable seating is just a no-no)
author: Pamplemouse L.

description: Food is fresh, service is good and staff friendly. Fav is the salmon plate and avocado toast. If I'm in the area I will definitely stop by.
author: Beverly M.

description: San Francisco's best spot for a deliciously healthy breakfast, lunch, and coffee. Their sandwiches are served on a single slice of gluten free toast and they are exquisite. The Avocado toast is a personal favorite, their GF bread is so soft and absolutely delicious that anyone can appreciate it. Lastly the super chic white decor and friendly staff add to the overall great experience!
author: C C.

description: Friendly staff. Delicous food and coffee. The baristas are quite talented and I also had this amazing juice and raw zuchinni pasta. Definitely would recommend.
author: Matthew L.

description: Delicious turmeric milk and avocado toast! Very health conscious food with a farm-to-table feel. It's a new restaurant so I feel they're going to be on the up-and-up very soon- the owner even works in the kitchen! Beautiful and minimalistic aesthetics. Can't wait to try more of their goodies!
author: Martine M.

description:
The drinks are cheap compare to rest of SF (Castro and SOMA)
Not sure if it's because of zero sugar or I am sick, the chai latte doesn't have much taste to eat. Feel more like I am drinking steamed milk.
author: Daisy S.

description: Amazing. From atmosphere to coffee to their banana muffin. Everything is spot on. Love the fluffiness of the banana muffin. It's like no other. Almost like 　　馬　拉　糕. Flavor doesn't taste artificial at all and the sweetness is just right. I'll be back again soon.
author: G C.

description: Love the coffee here! It's a great place for breakfast and lunch. I had the AB&J open face sandwich and loved it! The restaurant is beautiful too.
author: Christine D.

description: Clean, cool and good! Very fresh, tasty and innovative gluten free food. Great ambiance and service. Great drink selection - tough to decide between bone broth, turmeric latte or chai latte. Very fresh salads and open faced sandwiches.
author: Peter C.

description: Love this place! I have celiac and a dairy intolerance and had the best meal ever! So excited about this place and will definitely be back.
author: Richard G.

description: Lovely environment for working and great gluten free options. I really enjoyed my salmon open faced sandwich and the salads looked delicious as well. One note is a lot of the dishes have nuts so if that is a allergy as well you should ask before ordering. The gluten free bread is but free though and I enjoyed it.
author: Tess B.

description: I usually don't bother writing reviews unless I think they deserve it. After reading some of these reviews I have to warn you to not be discouraged!! I came here last Friday and loved there menu, beyond my expectations! Although it was extremely busy during lunch (around 12pm), we managed to find a space to sit in the back. We sat down and 5 min later this young lady (I think her name was Alejandra) offered us water/brought our food to the table. They have sparkling or flat by the way. We waited about ten minutes until our food came. We ordered two turmeric Lattes, avocado open face sandwich, a taco salad and a muffin for desert. Food was amazing and didn't disappoint. The proportions are just enough to fill you up! The young lady who brought our food told us that they recently opened, haven't been open for a month yet! I'm definitely coming back!
author: Anabell W.

description: We had high hopes for this very Instagram worthy spot. Unfortunately it disappointed on all fronts. Our meal arrived cold, with a mealy avocado. I tried to customize a latte and juice and was disappointed to realize they are all pre-blended. The staff was unfriendly and unhelpful. Such a great concept but terribly executed. We will not be back.
author: J S.

description: This place is a goddamned Portlandia sketch. A staff of seemingly hundreds doing nothing aside from looking affected, bored, and almost insulted that you dared order a slice of toast for $8. Probably why it takes them almost 30 minutes to lightly heat up a slice of bread and smear skippy on it. But hey, the tech kids who outgrew the Mission when they accidentally raw dogged it one night need some place to feed their kids grapes after yoga.
author: Scott B.

description: Hallelujah - finally good food and coffee in a nice space on Sacramento!
author: Susan W.

description: Came here to try the turmeric latte, was not disappointed. Staff is courteous and space is open and welcoming.
author: Sobia A.

description: The coffee and employees are great as is the ambiance and overall look/feel of the place. It's like the Apple store of cafes. White, clean, and simple yet inviting. The restaurant is only a month old so they're still figuring out their processes of serving guests, which they told me. I've worked at a restaurant before so I totally get it and while my latte took longer than normal, they gave me a credit for a free coffee as I had to wait...however, it was so good and such a nice, clean place to be in, I would have come back anyway. Great new place in the neighborhood and can't wait to try the food - they even have gluten free croutons! Like srsly I haven't had a crouton since that unfortunate celiac test. *Hello lover*
author: Stephanie N.

description: Love this place! ESPECIALLY THE TACO SALAD. Service is great, food is fresh and tasty! Prices are reasonable given the quality! Highly recommend
author: H B.

description: After waiting over a year for the restaurant to open, I must say that I was disappointed in the food selections. the The cafe is very nice , clean and comfortable BUT, today I ordered the BLT to go. When I picked it up, I thought it was a little on the light side and when I opened it, I literally thought they had forgotten to put it in the box. There was one slice of bread, spread with mayo, covered with lettuce , 2 cherry tomatoes cut in half , and one piece of bacon! That was it.....all for $8.00. In no way was it a meal.....a very small appetizer perhaps. If you are hungry, this is not the place to be.....coffee is good, employees very nice, but their portions of food are terrible. I don't think I will be going back for anything except coffee.
author: Gail B.

description: The store is very well designed and the espresso station is very cool. Very hi-tech. Coffee is badly needed in this neighborhood but, unfortunately, As Quoted falls short. I can't really say how good the coffee is, but given the wide availability of great beans locally, I'm going to assume it's good. Unfortunately, the barista did not know how to make coffee drinks. The milk in the cappuccino was way too hot and there was no foam. So the espresso was killed by too much, too hot, steamed milk. Not drinkable without letting it cool for 15 minutes but no point as the coffee was already dead. The best Blue Bottle innovation was not their beans or stores but the requirement that other shops who used their beans had to have their baristas trained.  Obviously not the case for the As Quoted beans provider. I assume that this barista was new, in training. But there is no reason at this point in time to have bad baristas at high end coffee shops in SF.   There's already a Starbucks in the neighborhood if you want bad coffee. And, unfortunately, Peets is better than the coffee I got at As Quoted. Neighborhood is still in need of a good coffee shop.
author: Neil B.

description: So glad to have this cafe in the neighborhood! I work nearby and although Laurel Village has plenty of food options, sometimes I just want something light and healthy for lunch--the kind of food that won't give me indigestion or food coma for the rest of the afternoon. The day I was there, the soup of the day was carrot, ginger and bone broth and it was dee-lish! My only complaint is that the portions are smaller than I expected. But there's plenty of seating and free wifi to make up for it. Can't wait to come here again and try out the rest of the menu.
author: Teresa L.

description: The decor is sensational, simple and with great wooden and brass details, all white clean and bright with a back deck.  The coffee is very good and fairly priced as is the food. Tried the grapefruit brûlée and it was delicious! Pretty busy and the service was kind and not stressed out like a lot of coffee spots tend to get.
author: Amanda V.

description: Not only is the food unique and delicious it is such high quality and nutritious. The decor is beautiful and calming. The tumeric latte and bone soup are nourishing and are indicative of   the attention to detail and time spent on developing recipes and the menu. A wonderful addition to the neighborhood and the City.
author: reggie g.

description: I met a friend today for lunch and had my first experience at As Quoted and was truly thrilled!  The environment is bright and clean.  The wait staff polite, friendly, and attentive.  I like that they had a community table as well as some small tables for personal chatting.  :)  The menu is small, but quality.  4 salads, 4 open faced sandwiches, teas, bone broth, smoothies.  All healthy, clean food, which is how I like to eat.  The Chinese chicken salad was light, clean, and tasty!  Would definitely have it again.  I can see why my friend is addicted!  Interested in trying the kale caesar as well.  We also shared one of the chocolate chip cookies and I was hooked!  Great texture, creamy chocolate chunks, melt in your mouth goodness, with a touch of salt to bring the whole thing together.  I honestly thought about ordering more to take home, but resisted...this time!  That ensures I have to return soon!  Great location, the businesses in the neighborhood seem happy As Quoted is there.  I am excited to see how the menu evolves.  Thanks again for a great experience!
author: Lynda C.
